question: Software testing activities should start
options: as soon as the code is written
during the design stage
when the requirements have been formally documented
as soon as possible in the development life cycle

question: Faults found by users are due to:
options: Poor quality software
Poor software and poor testing
bad luck
insufficient time for testing

question: What is the main reason for testing software before releasing it?
options: to show that system will work after release
to decide when the software is of sufficient quality to release
to find as many bugs as possible before release
to give information for a risk based decision about release

question: Which of the following statements is not true?
options: performance testing can be done during unit testing as well as during the testing of whole system
The acceptance test does not necessarily include a regression test
Verification activities should not involve testers (reviews, inspections etc)
Test environments should be as similar to production environments as possible

question: When reporting faults found to developers, testers should be:
options: as polite, constructive and helpful as possible
firm about insisting that a bug is not a “feature” if it should be fixed
diplomatic, sensitive to the way they may react to criticism
All of the above

question: In which order should tests be run?
options: the most important tests first
the most difficult tests first(to allow maximum time for fixing)
the easiest tests first(to give initial confidence)
the order they are thought of

question: The later in the development life cycle a fault is discovered, the more expensive it is to fix. Why?

options.question: What is the primary purpose of acceptance testing?
options: To find as many defects as possible
To validate that the system meets business requirements
To verify that the system integrates correctly with other systems
To ensure the system performs well under load
the documentation is poor, so it takes longer to find out what the software is doing.
wages are rising
the fault has been built into more documentation, code, tests, etc
none of the above

question: Which is not true-The black box tester
options: should be able to understand a functional specification or requirements document
should be able to understand the source code.
is highly motivated to find faults
is creative to find the system’s weaknesses

question: A test design technique is
options: a process for selecting test cases
a process for determining expected outputs
a way to measure the quality of software
a way to measure in a test plan what has to be done

question: Testware (test cases, test dataset)
options: needs configuration management just like requirements, design and code
should be newly constructed for each new version of the software
is needed only until the software is released into production or use
does not need to be documented and commented, as it does not form part of the released software system

question: An incident logging system
options: only records defects
is of limited value
is a valuable source of project information during testing if it contains all incidents
should be used only by the test team.

question: Increasing the quality of the software, by better development methods, will affect the time needed for testing (the test phases) by:
options: reducing test time
no change
increasing test time
can’t say

question: Coverage measurement
options: is nothing to do with testing
is a partial measure of test thoroughness
branch coverage should be mandatory for all software
can only be applied at unit or module testing, not at system testing

question: When should you stop testing?
options: when time for testing has run out.
when all planned tests have been run
when the test completion criteria have been met
when no faults have been found by the tests run

question: Which of the following is true?
options: Component testing should be black box, system testing should be white box.
if u find a lot of bugs in testing, you should not be very confident about the quality of software
the fewer bugs you find, the better your testing was
the more tests you run, the more bugs you will find.

question: What is the important criterion in deciding what testing technique to use?
options: how well you know a particular technique
the objective of the test
how appropriate the technique is for testing the application
whether there is a tool to support the technique

question: Using the same code example as question 17,how many tests are required to achieve 100% branch/decision coverage?
Which of the following is NOT a type of non-functional test?
options: State-Transition
Usability
Performance
Security

question: Which of the following tools would you use to detect a memory leak?
options: State analysis
Coverage analysis
Dynamic analysis
Memory analysis

question: Which of the following is NOT a standard related to testing?
options: IEEE829
IEEE610

question: Which of the following is the component test standard?
options: IEEE 829
IEEE 610

question: Which of the following statements are true?
options: Faults in program specifications are the most expensive to fix.
Faults in code are the most expensive to fix.
Faults in requirements are the most expensive to fix
Faults in designs are the most expensive to fix.

question: Which of the following is not the integration strategy?
options: Design based
Big-bang
Bottom-up
Top-down

question: Which of the following is a black box design technique?
options: statement testing
equivalence partitioning
error- guessing
usability testing

question: A program with high cyclometic complexity is almost likely to be:
options: Large
Small
Difficult to write
Difficult to test

question: Which of the following is a static test?
options: code inspection
coverage analysis
usability assessment
installation test

question: Which of the following is the odd one out?
options: white box
glass box
structural
functional

question:
A program validates a numeric field as follows:
values less than 10 are rejected, values between 10 and 21 are accepted, values greater than or equal to 22 are rejected
which of the following input values cover all of the equivalence partitions?
Using the same specifications as question 29, which of the following covers the MOST boundary values?
Which of these activities provides the biggest potential cost saving from the use of CAST?
options: Test management
Test design
Test execution
Test planning

question: What is the primary purpose of static testing?
options: To find defects early in the lifecycle
To execute tests based on requirements
To simulate real user behavior
To validate system integration

question: Which of the following is an example of a non-functional requirement?
options: The software must process 10,000 transactions per second
The system must allow users to create an account
The system should allow data to be retrieved from a database
The system should be able to process user requests within 2 seconds

question: In boundary value analysis, which of the following is the correct set of test cases for an input range from 10 to 20?
What is the goal of regression testing?
options: To find defects in the new code and features
To ensure that previously fixed defects do not reoccur
To test the system’s performance
To validate the system’s compliance with the requirements

question: Which of the following best describes the term 'defect density'?
options: The number of defects found in the system divided by the number of test cases executed
The total number of defects found per unit of code or function
The number of defects found during system testing
The number of defects found in the production environment

question: Which testing level is primarily concerned with evaluating the system as a whole, including its integration with external systems?
options: Unit testing
Integration testing
System testing
Acceptance testing

question: What is a key advantage of using automated testing?
options: It can replace manual testing for all test types
It helps execute large numbers of repetitive test cases quickly
It reduces the need for skilled testers
It can identify design flaws in the system

question: Which of the following is NOT a typical activity in test planning?
options: Defining the test strategy
Defining test objectives
Designing individual test cases
Estimating the time required for testing

question: Which of these testing types focuses on validating the user experience and usability of a system?
options: Functional testing
Usability testing
Security testing
Compatibility testing
